text: For topic modeling , we use the widely applied LDA ( Blei et al. , 2003 ) .
citing_paper_title: a holistic lexiconbased approach to opinion mining
extended_context: In addition to these linear topic segmentation algorithms , there are hierarchical segmentation algorithms , see ( Yaari , 1997 ; Hsueh et al. , 2006 ; Eisenstein , 2009 ) . For topic modeling , we use the widely applied LDA ( Blei et al. , 2003 ) . This generative probabilistic model uses a training corpus of documents to create document-topic and topic-word distributions and is parameterized by the number of topics N as well as by two hyperparameters .
cleaned_cite_text: For topic modeling , we use the widely applied LDA ( @@CITATION ) .

text: With C99 ( Choi , 2000 ) an algorithm was introduced that uses a matrix-based ranking and a clustering approach in order to relate the most similar textual units and to cluster groups of consecutive units into segments .
citing_paper_title: a holistic lexiconbased approach to opinion mining
cited_paper_title: advances in domain independent linear text segmentation
extended_context: TextTiling ( TT ) ( Hearst , 1994 ) relies on the simplest coherence relation -- word repetition -- and computes similarities between textual units based on the similarities of word space vectors . With C99 ( Choi , 2000 ) an algorithm was introduced that uses a matrix-based ranking and a clustering approach in order to relate the most similar textual units and to cluster groups of consecutive units into segments . Both TT and C99 characterize textual units by the words they contain .
cleaned_cite_text: With C99 ( @@CITATION ) an algorithm was introduced that uses a matrix-based ranking and a clustering approach in order to relate the most similar textual units and to cluster groups of consecutive units into segments .

text: For the C99 algorithm ( Choi , 2000 ) , named ( C99LDA ) when using topic IDs , the text is divided into minimal units on sentence boundaries .

text: TextTiling ( TT ) ( Hearst , 1994 ) relies on the simplest coherence relation -- word repetition -- and computes similarities between textual units based on the similarities of word space vectors .
citing_paper_title: a holistic lexiconbased approach to opinion mining
extended_context: Based on the observation of Halliday and Hasan ( 1976 ) that the density of coherence relations is higher within segments than between segments , most algorithms compute a coherence score to measure the difference of textual units for informing a segmentation decision . TextTiling ( TT ) ( Hearst , 1994 ) relies on the simplest coherence relation -- word repetition -- and computes similarities between textual units based on the similarities of word space vectors . With C99 ( Choi , 2000 ) an algorithm was introduced that uses a matrix-based ranking and a clustering approach in order to relate the most similar textual units and to cluster groups of consecutive units into segments .
cleaned_cite_text: TextTiling ( TT ) ( @@CITATION ) relies on the simplest coherence relation -- word repetition -- and computes similarities between textual units based on the similarities of word space vectors .

text: In TextTiling ( TT ) ( Hearst , 1994 ) using topic IDs ( TTLDA ) , a document D , which is subject to segmentation , is represented as a sequence of n topic IDs1 .
citing_paper_title: a holistic lexiconbased approach to opinion mining
extended_context: In TextTiling ( TT ) ( Hearst , 1994 ) using topic IDs ( TTLDA ) , a document D , which is subject to segmentation , is represented as a sequence of n topic IDs1 . TT splits the document into topic-sequences , instead of sentences , where each sequence consists of w topic IDs .
